alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 18 at 2:50AM AKST until November 19 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For Thompson Pass, Blizzard conditions expected. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile. For Keystone Canyon and Valdez, blowing snow with visibility reduced to one half mile at times. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero through Thompson Pass could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...No additional snow is expected during this event. Reduced visibilities will be caused by winds lifting and blowing transportable snow already on the ground.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
